SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.levels

Class LevelParent

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
com.example.demo.levels.LevelParent
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelOne, LevelThree, LevelTwo
public abstract class LevelParent extends Observable
Abstract class LevelParent. This class serves as a base class for implementing different levels in the game. It manages game components such as user planes, enemy units, projectiles, and the game timeline. LevelParent includes methods for initializing and updating the game scene, handling user inputs, managing game states (e.g., pause and options), and transitioning between levels.

Original Source Code: LevelParent

    • LevelParent

      public LevelParent(String backgroundImageName, double screenHeight, double screenWidth, int playerInitialHealth, int killsToAdvance)
      Constructor for LevelParent.
      Parameters:
      backgroundImageName - The name of the background image file.
      screenHeight - The height of the game screen.
      screenWidth - The width of the game screen.
      playerInitialHealth - Initial health of the player.
      killsToAdvance - Number of kills required to advance to the next level.

    • showEndOptions

      public void showEndOptions()
      Displays the end-game options, including Restart and Exit buttons, in a styled VBox. This method is invoked when the game ends, either in victory or defeat.

    • initializeBossHealthDisplay

      protected void initializeBossHealthDisplay()
      Initializes the display of the boss health bar for Level Three. This method dynamically creates and styles the health bar and label.

    • initializeKillCounter

      protected void initializeKillCounter()
      Sets up the kill counter display, showing the player's progress toward the required kills to advance.

    • updateBossHealth

      public void updateBossHealth(Boss boss)
      Updates the boss's health bar based on the boss's current health. If the boss's health reaches zero, the health bar is removed from the screen.
      Parameters:
      boss - The boss whose health is being monitored.

    • winGame

      protected void winGame()
      Handles the actions to perform when the player wins the game, including stopping the timeline, displaying a win image, and showing end options.

    • loseGame

      protected void loseGame()
      Handles the actions to perform when the player loses the game, including stopping the timeline, displaying a game-over image, and showing end options.
